fields.request: Manual QA: Confirm clean upgrades reload personal fixture data
fields.request_details:
1. On a staging node, create a personal fixture by running `python manage.py dumpdata core.userdata --indent 2 --output data/userdata.json` after ensuring at least one UserData row exists.
2. Remove that row from the live database with `python manage.py shell -c "from core.models import UserData; UserData.objects.all().delete()"`.
3. Execute `./upgrade.sh --clean --no-restart` and allow it to finish, confirming that the confirmation prompt is accepted.
4. Verify `python manage.py shell -c "from core.models import UserData; print(UserData.objects.exists())"` returns True, showing data/userdata.json was reloaded after the clean upgrade.
